intro: Myosotis versicolor var. canariensis, commonly known as the Canary blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers, which are typically five-petaled and resemble those of the common forget-me-not. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its delicate, herbaceous growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
